 103:         for x in range(width):
 104:             # print (x,y,(surfOrFile[y][x]))
 105:             r = surfOrFile[y][x]
 106:             if (r and 0b10000000): #if (r<128)
 107:                 color = white
 108:             else:
 109:                 color = black
 110:             if prevColor == nocolor: prevColor = color
 111:             isLastPixel = (x == lastX and lastLine)
 112:             if color == prevColor and nrOfColor < 0x7D and not isLastPixel:
 113:                 nrOfColor = nrOfColor + 1
 114:             else:
 115:                 # print (color,nrOfColor,nrOfColor<<1)
 116:                 encValue = (prevColor << 7) | nrOfColor  # push color (B/W) to highest bit and repetitions to lowest 7 bits.
 117:                 rleData.append(encValue)
 118:                 prevColor = color
 119:                 nrOfColor = 1
 120: 
 121:     return bytes(rleData)
 122: 
 123: #!python
 124: @cython.wraparound (False) #turn off negative indexing
 125: @cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 126: @cython.nonecheck(False)
 127: def encodedBitmap_Bytes_nonumpy1D(list surfOrFile not None):
 128:     #(width, height) = (1440, 2560)
 129:     cdef unsigned int nrPixels = 3686400
 130:     cdef unsigned int lastPixel = nrPixels - 1
 131: 
 132:     # Count number of pixels with same color up until 0x7D/125 repetitions
 133:     rleData = bytearray() # convert bytearray to cdef array has no speed benefit
 134:     cdef unsigned char color = 0
 135:     cdef unsigned char prevColor = 0
 136:     cdef unsigned char black = 0
 137:     cdef unsigned char white = 1
 138:     cdef unsigned char nocolor=3
 139:     cdef unsigned char r
 140:     cdef unsigned char nrOfColor = 0
 141:     cdef unsigned char encValue = 0
 142:     cdef unsigned int pixelNr
 143:     cdef unsigned int isLastPixel = False
 144:     prevColor = nocolor
 145: 
 146:     for pixelNr in range(nrPixels):
 147:         r = surfOrFile[pixelNr]
 148:         if (r and 0b10000000): #if (r<128)
 149:             color = white
 150:         else:
 151:             color = black
 152:         if prevColor == nocolor: prevColor = color
 153:         isLastPixel = (pixelNr == lastPixel)
 154:         if color == prevColor and nrOfColor < 0x7D and not isLastPixel:
 155:             nrOfColor = nrOfColor + 1
 156:         else:
 157:             # print (color,nrOfColor,nrOfColor<<1)
 158:             encValue = (prevColor << 7) | nrOfColor  # push color (B/W) to highest bit and repetitions to lowest 7 bits.
 159:             rleData.append(encValue)
 160:             prevColor = color
 161:             nrOfColor = 1
 162: 
 163:     return bytes(rleData)
 164: 
 165: from cpython cimport array
 166: #!python
 167: @cython.wraparound (False) # turn off negative indexing
 168: @cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 169: @cython.nonecheck(False)
 170: def encodedBitmap_Bytes_nonumpy1DBlock(list surfOrFile not None):
 171: 
 172:     # Make room for rleData
 173:     cdef templatemv = array.array('B')
 174:     cdef rleData = array.array('B')
 175:     rleData = array.clone(templatemv, 3686400, zero=False)
 176: 
 177:     # Some constants for nr of pixels and last pixelnr
 178:     cdef unsigned int nrPixels = 3686400 #(width, height) = (1440, 2560)
 179:     cdef unsigned int lastPixel = nrPixels - 1
 180: 
 181:     # Count number of pixels with same color up until 0x7D/125 repetitions
 182:     cdef unsigned char color = 0
 183:     cdef unsigned char prevColor = 0
 184:     cdef unsigned char black = 0
 185:     cdef unsigned char white = 1
 186:     cdef unsigned char nocolor=3
 187:     cdef unsigned char r
 188:     cdef unsigned char nrOfColor = 0
 189:     cdef unsigned char encValue = 0
 190:     cdef unsigned int pixelNr
 191:     cdef unsigned int isLastPixel = False
 192:     cdef unsigned int nrBytes=0
 193:     prevColor = nocolor
 194:     for pixelNr in range(nrPixels):
 195:         r = surfOrFile[pixelNr]
 196:         if (r and 0b10000000): #if (r<128)
 197:             color = white
 198:         else:
 199:             color = black
 200:         if prevColor == nocolor: prevColor = color
 201:         isLastPixel = (pixelNr == lastPixel)
 202:         if color == prevColor and nrOfColor < 0x7D and not isLastPixel:
 203:             nrOfColor = nrOfColor + 1
 204:         else:
 205:             # print (color,nrOfColor,nrOfColor<<1)
 206:             encValue = (prevColor << 7) | nrOfColor  # push color (B/W) to highest bit and repetitions to lowest 7 bits.
 207:             rleData[nrBytes]=encValue
 208:             nrBytes = nrBytes+1
 209:             prevColor = color
 210:             nrOfColor = 1
 211: 
 212:     # Remove excess bytes and return rleData
 213:     array.resize(rleData,nrBytes)
 214:     return bytes(rleData)
 215: 
 216: 
 217: 
 218: 
 219: import numpy
 220: cimport numpy
 221: #ctypedef numpy.npy_float FLOAT
 222: #ctypedef numpy.npy_intp INTP
 223: 
 224: #!python
 225: @cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 226: @cython.wraparound(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 227: def encodedBitmap_Bytes_withnumpy(numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_uint8,ndim=1] x):
 228: 
 229:     # Encoding magic
 230:     cdef unsigned int n=0
 231:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_int64, ndim = 1] starts # npy_int64
 232:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_int64, ndim = 1] lengths# npy_int64
 233:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_uint8, ndim = 1] values # npy_uint8
 234: 
 235:     where = numpy.flatnonzero
 236:     n = len(x)
 237:     starts = numpy.r_[0, where(~numpy.isclose(x[1:], x[:-1], equal_nan=True)) + 1]
 238:     lengths = numpy.diff(numpy.r_[starts, n])
 239:     values = x[starts]
 240: 
 241:     # Reduce repetitions of color to max 0x7D/125 and store in bytearray
 242:     rleData = bytearray()
 243:     cdef unsigned int nr=0
 244:     cdef unsigned int col=0
 245:     cdef unsigned char color=0
 246:     cdef unsigned char encValue = 0
 247: 
 248:     cdef unsigned int l=len(lengths)
 249:     cdef unsigned int i=0
 250:     for i in range (0,l):
 251:         nr=lengths[i]
 252:         col=values[i]
 253:         # color = (abs(col)>1) # slow
 254:         color = 1 if col else 0  # fast
 255:         while nr > 0x7D:
 256:             encValue = (color << 7) | 0x7D
 257:             rleData.append(encValue)
 258:             nr = nr - 0x7D
 259:         encValue = (color << 7) | nr
 260:         rleData.append(encValue)
 261: 
 262:     # Needed is an byte string, so convert
 263:     return bytes(rleData)
 264: 
 265: #import numpy as numpy
 266: #cimport numpy as numpy
 267: #DTYPE = numpy.uint8
 268: #ctypedef numpy.uint8_t DTYPE_t
 269: #!python
 270: @cython.boundscheck(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 271: @cython.wraparound(False) # turn off bounds-checking
 272: def encodedBitmap_Bytes_withnumpy2(numpy.ndarray[DTYPE_t,ndim=1] x):
 273: 
 274:     # Encoding magic
 275:     cdef unsigned int n=0
 276:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_int64, ndim = 1] starts # npy_int64
 277:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_int64, ndim = 1] lengths# npy_int64
 278:     cdef numpy.ndarray[numpy.npy_uint8, ndim = 1] values # npy_uint8
 279: 
 280:     where = numpy.flatnonzero
 281:     n = len(x)
 282:     starts = numpy.r_[0, where(~numpy.isclose(x[1:], x[:-1], equal_nan=True)) + 1]
 283:     lengths = numpy.diff(numpy.r_[starts, n])
 284:     values = x[starts]
 285: 
 286:     # Reduce repetitions of color to max 0x7D/125 and store in bytearray
 287:     cdef numpy.ndarray[DTYPE_t, ndim = 1] rleData = numpy.zeros((3686400), dtype=DTYPE)
 288:     cdef unsigned int nr=0
 289:     cdef unsigned int col=0
 290:     cdef unsigned char color=0
 291:     cdef unsigned char encValue = 0
 292: 
 293:     cdef unsigned int l=len(lengths)
 294:     cdef unsigned int i=0
 295:     cdef unsigned int nrBytes = 0
 296: 
 297:     for i in range (0,l):
 298:         nr=lengths[i]
 299:         col=values[i]
 300:         # color = (abs(col)>1) # slow
 301:         color = 1 if col else 0  # fast
 302:         while nr > 0x7D:
 303:             encValue = (color << 7) | 0x7D
 304:             rleData[nrBytes] = encValue
 305:             nrBytes = nrBytes + 1
 306:             nr = nr - 0x7D
 307:         encValue = (color << 7) | nr
 308:         rleData[nrBytes] = encValue
 309:         nrBytes = nrBytes + 1
 310: 
 311:     # Needed is an byte string, so convert
 312:     rleData = rleData[:nrBytes]
 313:     return bytes(rleData)
 314: 
 315: """
